summary:
The Council invites individuals, companies, and States named in the report to send their reactions to the Secretariat by 31 March 2003 and requests publication of these reactions by 15 April 2003.

The Council stresses the importance of dialogue between the Panel, individuals, companies, and States, and requests the Panel to provide information to those named, while preserving the safety of its sources.

The Council emphasizes the duty of those named to respect confidentiality to preserve the safety of the Panel's sources.

The Council requests the Panel to provide information to the OECD Committee and National Contact Points regarding business enterprises allegedly in contravention of OECD guidelines.

The Council urges States, especially in the region, to conduct investigations into the Panel's findings, and notes with satisfaction the decisions of the Attorney General of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the Government of Uganda to start judicial procedures.

The Council encourages organizations to consider the Panel's recommendations, and encourages specialized industries' organizations to monitor trade in commodities from conflict areas.

The Council supports the Panel and reiterates that all parties and relevant States must extend full cooperation to the Panel while ensuring necessary security for the experts.

The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
